client.protocol

Interface Connect4Client

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    Protocoller

    public interface Connect4Client

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void cmdHello(java.lang.String username, boolean isAi, int clientCapabilities)
      Command to register this client on the server.

    • Method Detail

      • cmdHello

        void cmdHello(java.lang.String username,
              boolean isAi,
              int clientCapabilities)
       throws java.io.IOException
        Command to register this client on the server. If the registering is successful a response in the shape of the WELCOME command can be expected from the server.
        Parameters:
        username - the desired username to be displayed on the scoreboard.
        clientCapabilities - an integer acting as a boolean flag vector. Every bit corresponds to a capability. Setting a certain bit to 0 means the client is reporting that it does not have an implementation for the associated capability.
        isAI - true indicates that the user that is registering is a computer player. false indicates a human player.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • cmdMove

        void cmdMove(int x,
             int y)
      throws java.io.IOException
        The x and y coordinate of the desired move. The coordinate system is defined as follows:
        NB: See this javadoc in the editor for the correct layout in ASCII art
        x -->
        `O`` 0 1 2 3 4 5
        y `` _._._._._._
        ` 0 |_|_|_|_|_|_|
        | 1 |_|_|_|_|_|_|
        V 2 |_|_|_|_|_|_|
        ` 3 |_|_|_|_|_|_|
        Parameters:
        x - the x coordinate of the move
        y - the y coordinate of the move
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
